title: Avant-Garde Now: Time Travellers
location: House 1, M+ Cinema‎, M+ Museum, WestK
description:
M+ Cinema

M+ Cinema is a vibrant Hong Kong destination dedicated to celebrating the richness of visual culture on screen.

M+ Cinema presents a cross-disciplinary programme of feature films, documentaries, experimental cinema, video art, restored classics, and newly discovered or rarely seen films.




Avant-Garde Now: Time Travellers  

Avant-Garde Now is a regular series of one-day events exploring current trends in artists’ moving image practices. For the Time Travellers edition, four invited artists—Monira Al Qadiri, Cao Fei, Meiro Koizumi, and Subash Thebe Limbu—will present performance lectures, screenings, and VR experiences that use speculative and futuristic narratives to manipulate and empower understandings of time. Blending science fiction, mythology, and culture, these artists imagine possible futures while holding up a mirror to our world today. Curatorial presentations and discussions between artists and audiences will also deepen understanding and foster dialogue around these themes.




Schedule

10:00–17:30: Meiro Koizumi | VR experience

11:00–12:30: Subash Thebe Limbu | Screening and in-person conversation

12:30–14:00: Lunch break

14:00–15:00: Monira Al Qadiri | Performance lecture

15:00–15:30: Coffee break

15:30–16:00: Meiro Koizumi | In-person conversation

16:00–17:40: Cao Fei | Screening

17:45–18:30: Artists’ Roundtable

Notice to Ticket-Purchasers

1. This event uses e-tickets, please present QR code for admission with the following options:

Print out the e-ticket in the confirmation email on A4-sized paper.
Present digital copy on your mobile device: please make sure that full QR can be shown with minimum size of 3cm X 3cm.
Present E-ticket(s) stored in the Cityline Ticketing App (Cityline member)
Once the e-ticket is used, the QR code will be deactivated from the system and cannot be reused.
Ticket must be scanned before exiting the venue if you wish to re-enter. Failure to do so may result in inability to re-enter, no refunds shall be provided.

2. One person per Ticket, regardless of age.

3. Tickets cannot be exchanged nor payment refunded.

4. Entry may be refused if any details on the Ticket have been omitted or altered or if the Ticket is damaged, defaced or otherwise mutilated.

5. Holders of concessionary Tickets will be admitted only on production of acceptable proof of eligibility.

6. Latecomers will be admitted only if there is a suitable break in the performance.

7. Ticket holders must produce proof of age if required to do so by the Venue Manager.

8. Children’s admission arrangements vary according to the Event.

9. If you have any enquiry, please contact our Ticketing Hotline at (852) 2200 0022 or email ticketinfo@wkcda.hk or visit http://www.westk.hk/

10. All Tickets are sold subject to the Terms and Conditions for Sale of Entertainment Tickets.

11. Tickets purchased through this Ticketing Platform are legitimate, subject to its Terms and Conditions.  Tickets obtained from any other sources may not be authentic, and this Ticketing Platform cannot guarantee their validity.

12. No change of submitted information upon transaction under any circumstances.

13 All successful transactions will receive a confirmation email. Please email cs@cityline.com for any inquiries.

14. The seat plan is for reference only. The Organiser reserves the rights to change the prices, seating arrangement and capacity.

15. In case of dispute arising from the ticketing sales and promotion of "《Avant-Garde Now: Time Travellers》", the decision of the Organiser and this Ticketing Platform shall be final.

*Terms & Conditions

For Cityline’s terms and conditions, please visit here.

title: The Happiness of the Katakuris
location: House 1, M+ Cinema‎, M+ Museum, WestK
description:
M+ Cinema

M+ Cinema is a vibrant Hong Kong destination dedicated to celebrating the richness of visual culture on screen.

M+ Cinema presents a cross-disciplinary programme of feature films, documentaries, experimental cinema, video art, restored classics, and newly discovered or rarely seen films.




The Happiness of the Katakuris

Laid off from his corporate job, middle-aged family man Masao (Kenji Sawada) buys an old house in a resort town and turns it into a bed and breakfast. Though he and his family run the place with hope and optimism, their little inn struggles to attract guests.  Just when they think they have turned a corner with their first guest, their real nightmare has only just begun.

Barely a month after presenting the shockingly violent Ichi the Killer (2001) at Toronto International Film Festival, director Takashi Miike debuted The Happiness of the Katakuris—a horror comedy— at Tokyo International Film Festival. A delirious concoction that includes claymation, song and dance, and karaoke, The Happiness of the Katakuris is as zany as films come. Best known for his gory pictures, the prolific Japanese director showcases a wide range of creative prowess in this hilarious gem.

This film will be presented in a rare 35mm print.

Notice to Ticket-Purchasers

1. This event uses e-tickets, please present QR code for admission with the following options:
